title: Ticket #2156: Clean up test's stderr
description:
Our test generate useless noise in standard error. It would be nice to say nothing in the default, successful case, simplifying debugging. Representative output.

  • "Warning: Host name 'nmi-0251' is not an FQDN!! at batch_test.pl line 118." - Move to standard output? Don't complain at all, since it's clearly not a problem?
  • "Error executing condor_config_val: '0' 'Illegal seek' at batch_test.pl line 1218."
    - Test is backward, not actually failing.
  • "Configuration source:" and "Local configuration source:"
    - batch_test.pl merges stderr into stdout now. Core problem is #2157
remarks:
2011-May-12 15:59:23 by adesmet:
"Configuration source:" and "Local configuration source:" are being emitted by condor_config_val, which mixes output to stderr and stdout (/src/condor_tools/config_val.cpp line 716-729). This seems... wrong. But it's worth checking to see if this is intentional; perhaps to let scripts get the list of files in stdout and ignore stderr? See #2157

2011-May-12 16:38:58 by adesmet:
testing

2011-May-13 11:32:24 by adesmet:
Confirmed. A typical test generates no stderr now, simpifying checking for errors.
check_ins:
2011-May-12 16:25   Check-in [21860]: The entire hostname checking codepath appears to serve no purpose and has several disadvantages. Removed. - #2158 - Stop uselessly sleep(10)ing - #2156 - Stop writing useless warning to stderr ===GT=== #2158 #2156 (By Alan De Smet )
2011-May-12 16:00   Check-in [21859]: When calling "condor_config_val -config", merge stdout and stderr together. We're just dumping it for user review anyway and it's more useful in light of #2157 Testing change, no version history needed. ===GT=== #2156 (By Alan De Smet )
2011-May-12 15:41   Check-in [21858]: Fix spurious warning in test output. Test for success was backward, Perl's close returns true on success, not false. Also added a comment about some questionable logic. Regression testing, not use visible, no version history entry necessary. ===GT=== #2156 (By Alan De Smet )
creator: adesmet
